page.title: 16Ecology of Cronton
page.content: {Ecology}The area showing most ecological interest is Pex Hill. {Pex Hill}is an outcrop of Sandstone overlain by boulder clay drift.The highest point of the hill is approx. 64 metres at it's North end.It is one of the few remaining areas of Lowland Heath in Merseyside, and is a refuge for wildlife in an area divided between intensive farming and urban settlement. {Vegetation}The most common vegetation found is:bracken,grass,heather,gorse and oak.There are no rare plants.The hill contains a dissused quarry,plant species found there are not found on the rest of the hill.There is a family of foxes on the hill. {Nature Conservancy}Council has established a conservation area on the hill,much work is being done to make it a pleasant place for the people.
